importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The final days of January 2024 mark the time when the Hind Rajab family was killed in Gaza City, forming the core of the events detailed in the documentary.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The 52nd Armoured Battalion, including the 'Vampire Empire' company, entered Gaza in October 2023 and was involved in lethal operations, including the attack on the Rajab family in January 2024.

keyTakeAways: A documentary by Al Jazeera and the Hind Rajab Foundation reveals new evidence about the killing of five-year-old Hind Rajab, her family, and a rescue team in Gaza City on January 31, 2024.

The Israeli government initially claimed no Israeli forces were present and attributed the bullet holes in the Rajab family's car to an exchange of fire, but satellite imagery and audio analysis by Forensic Architecture found only Israeli Merkava tanks present, no exchange of fire.

Colonel Beni Aharon of the 401 Armoured Brigade is the overall commander of tanks near the incident and is already facing a criminal complaint at the International Criminal Court (ICC) by the Hind Rajab Foundation.

The 'Vampire Empire' company under Major Sean Glass, part of the 52nd Armoured Battalion commanded by Colonel Daniel Ella, is accused of directly responsible killings and tampering with the crime scene.
Soldier Itay Choukirkov, a dual Israeli-Argentine national, is currently being sued under Argentinian law for his alleged role in the murder.

The Hind Rajab Foundation has initiated legal actions against individual soldiers, including Shimon Zuckerman, a self-styled 'war influencer' who filmed destruction of the village of Khuza’a near Khan Younis, which the foundation claims shows genocidal intent.
Israeli security expert Yossi Melman stated that such prosecutions concern the Israeli government and military, especially due to the reputational risk and internal scrutiny from Shin Bet and Mossad.

summaryOfNewsArticle: A new Al Jazeera documentary, Ma Khafiya Aatham (Tip of the Iceberg), co-produced with the Hind Rajab Foundation, reveals evidence of the killing of five-year-old Hind Rajab and her family in Gaza City on January 31, 2024. The investigation, supported by Forensic Architecture’s satellite and audio analysis, disputes the Israeli government’s claim of an exchange of fire, showing only Israeli Merkava tanks present. The documentary identifies Colonel Beni Aharon of the 401 Armoured Brigade and the 'Vampire Empire' company—commanded by Major Sean Glass and under Colonel Daniel Ella—as directly responsible, with soldier Itay Choukirkov being sued under Argentinian law. The Hind Rajab Foundation alleges genocidal intent, citing footage from Shimon Zuckerman’s social media posts showing destruction of Khuza’a near Khan Younis. The case has prompted legal action at the International Criminal Court and has drawn criticism from Israeli security experts, who express concern over the reputational and internal risks of prosecuting military personnel for war crimes.
title: Al Jazeera documentary reveals new evidence in Hind Rajab family’s killing
